title: ICE: panicked at 'index out of bounds: the len is 153 but the index is 167', compiler/rustc_query_impl/src/on_disk_cache.rs

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
### Code N/A. ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.59.0-nightly (34926f0a1 2021-12-22) binary: rustc commit-hash: 34926f0a1681458588a2d4240c0715ef9eff7d35 commit-date: 2021-12-22 host: x86_64-apple-darwin release: 1.59.0-nightly LLVM version: 13.0.0 ``` ### Error output ``` thread 'rustc' panicked at 'index out of bounds: the len is 153 but the index is 167', compiler/rustc_query_impl/src/on_disk_cache.rs:712:18 ```
Backtrace

x86_64-apple-darwin note: compiler flags: -C embed-bitcode=no -C split-debuginfo=unpacked -C debuginfo=2 -C incremental --crate-type bin note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden query stack during panic: #0 [codegen_fulfill_obligation] checking if `Describe` fulfills its obligations #1 [resolve_instance] resolving instance ` as Describe>::describe` #2 [collect_and_partition_mono_items] collect_and_partition_mono_items end of query stack warning: `repl` (bin "repl") generated 4 warnings error: could not compile `repl`; 4 warnings emitted ```
